titleStmt.title: Minutes of Directors' Meeting of Shoshone Irrigation Company, February 25, 1908
titleStmt.sponsor: Supported in part by a grant from the Wyoming Cultural Trust Fund, a program of the Department of State Parks and Cultural Resources.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Minutes of Directors' Meeting of Shoshone Irrigation Company

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, MS407 Bronson Rumsey Collection

div1.note: DIRECTORS' MEETING of the SHOSHONE IRRIGATION COMPANY, held at HOTEL IROQUOIS, Buffalo, New York,
div1.p: Pursuant to call made by the President, the Board of Directors of the SHOSHONE IRRIGATION COMPANY met at Hotel Iroquois, Buffalo, New York, at 10 o'clock a.m. on the 25th day of February 1908.

Upon Roll Call, there were present: --
Col. William F. Cody
Bronson Rumsey
H. M. Gerrans
S. L. Samuels
George T. Beck.
A quorum being present, the meeting was called to order by Colonel Cody.
The minutes of December 8th 1906 were read and approved.

The President reported that the Bond of the State of Wyoming, given by the Company, had been cancelled and discharged. Also, that the segregated lands had been turned over to the Cody Canal Association, as directed at the last meeting of the Company. Contract with said Association was read.

The Secretary reported that the levy of Forty Cents
-2-
(40¢) was not made as directed by the Board at the last meeting, because the Ditch was turned over to the Settlers before it was necessary for said levy. That said Canal was turned over in February 1907, and that all salaries ceased then.
It was moved, seconded and carried, that the President take such steps as may be necessary to dissolve the Corporation, and his action in such respect is hereby ratified.
On motion, the meeting then adjourned.

closer.signed:
George T Beck
S E C R E T A R Y
